You are given an integer $P$ ($2 \le P \le 2.1 \cdot 10^6$) and a register of qubits representing an unsigned integer in little-endian format. 

Your task is to implement a quantum operation that performs the equivalent of the $P$-th power of the quantum Fourier transform (QFT) on the input register.  

The output is the state of the qubits after the operation is performed.

You are allowed to use existing quantum library functions, including `QFTLE` which implements the base QFT. 

The operation should have both adjoint and controlled variants.

Given a number and a list of bits, perform a specific transformation on the bits.  The transformation is defined by a function called QFT.  You can use a built-in function called QFTLE to help with the transformation.  The result is a new list of bits.
